text: oh nice that makes sense, thanks Ilich
Do you need to support IE11?

Hi! I've been working with the cms-react-boilerplate in a monorepo and I'm running into some errors I can't figure out. Does anyone have any experience with a similar use case? I'll put more specific info in the thread :point_down:

I have a 3 projects in my monorepo and the structure looks like this
```projects
   web
   header
   cms-react-boilerplate```
The `header` is a typescript project that has all the header components so I'll import it into my `web` package and also import it into `cms-react-boilerplate` which ideally will work and will handle all the HubSpot build things for me :crossed_fingers: However I'm getting this string of errors and I'm not sure where to look to fix these:
```<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] Uploading cms-react-boilerplate/main.js failed
<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] Error validating template.
<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] line 22964: Error parsing '*         ...defaultStyle,
<e>  *         ...transitionStyles[state]
<e>  *': syntax error at position -66, encountered '*', expected <IDENTIFIER>|<STRING>|<FLOAT>|<INTEGER>|'true'|'false'|'null'|'-'|'!'|'not'|'empty'|'('
<e> [HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin] line 0: Coded files must be smaller than 1.5 MiB```
There isn't even a `cms-react-boilerplate/main.js file`! I can't seem to find anything online and I've tried adjusting the `HubSpotAutoUploadPlugin` in `cms-react-bolierplate/webpack.config.js`  without success. Has anyone come across this before that could provide some tips? Thank you in advance for any help and for reading this whole thing!
Never mind I found the main.js file. It was in the dist folder :sweat_smile:
